document.title: National Standards Curriculum- Exploratory Core - Grade 6

2C66415DA9E9476588F8DBC7F0817278.description: •	Show responsible behaviour in the use of drugs

551777743BA14573A60BB927DC1BD40D.description: •	Describe the effects of drugs on the body

910D3CD22B7443D593F7CDCFA1FD746A.description: •	State the meaning of the term ‘drug’

107870F9B0004154ADFB1FC2B3280AE4.description: Why is the proper use of drugs important?

056B4F039C6C4D51A56602A2D48B4CAA.description: •	Use appropriate scientific language related to food and health

D8414546F30E4CB788DF9D01983DE17F.description: •	Show sensitivity to individuals who suffer from food related illnesses or challenges

0311FD819A5C42C6962BFEEB747DEAFA.description: •	Show concern for others who make unhealthy eating choices

6BEE80982A9B4CB2B34419296E17D0C9.description: •	Evaluate data to draw conclusions about the consequences of improper diets

72E5EF31D71047C6844B1F157F89E35E.description: •	Justify the need for eating healthy foods

AECEF473B5AF4F3395607E7F64A8D89B.description: •	Outline measures to mitigate against selected lifestyle diseases

5DED22475B3C4CF484A93600BA17687D.description: •	Assess the causes of obesity, diabetes and malnutrition

798FE6C826B54A1599CC58B988AD6C50.description: •	Explain some of the consequences of not having a balanced diet

BC8499AE101D454999FAE46ED100760E.description: Why is it important to have a balanced diet?

E5CAAE3FF6F84F998D93AFEE49223FB8.description: •	Use appropriate scientific vocabulary to describe mixtures

4CA9547ECA094CF58669CF551505954C.description: •	Conduct investigations with due regard to safety

47A9ECD163F34340A9FEBA4431A43F74.description: •	Demonstrate the separation of selected types of mixtures using various techniques.

D4563B8551D5478ABF44524B588EBCED.description: •	Recognise that all mixtures can be separated.

AF53FD2AE3154F0FA3B3A67996FECF30.description: •	Demonstrate that a mixture is made up of two or more substances.

3A4D939AB047478DBA20F35466CAAFEF.description: What is a mixture and how can mixtures be separated?

55A1894E7C884070A95215401596677C.description: •	Show curiosity in exploring their own body and questioning about the structures or functions of the body.

D10090648B244B49B64603DA175374C2.description: •	Identify the excretory organs of humans (kidneys, lungs and skin) and state their role in excretion

C8F8B70AF96249EDAD2A1E438C0FD48D.description: •	Describe how the bones, joints and muscles work together to produce movement in humans

676912E4EF834C2B8392330D2C603EC3.description: •	Identify selected organs in the human digestive system (mouth, oesophagus, stomach, small intestine, large intestine) and outline the path food travels from mouth to anus

039DB50BA8C543D987882E05C06286D6.description: •	Recognise the integration of the different organ systems in carrying out life processes

54D34457E8D54923B74F2906DC5CD22E.description: •	Identify the organ systems and state their functions in humans

AA7D2CC538734363BE4D9B80D767929D.description: •	Explain what is meant by the term ‘system’

005ECD515443474DB64E638E808C0E4C.description: What are some of the systems in my body and how do they work?

3A611820830B4982AE13700A934E3166.description: •	Test predictions of changes with actual observations

C7F655EEFA934FAFB14C549A3C7BA98C.description: •	Predict whether a change will be reversible or irreversible

F3FA9277723E4F9FBBCC91CC835DB455.description: •	Predict the effect of heat on selected materials

F1FDBC0AE0594FE3B2988DEC8EA0D383.description: •	Be willing to change their minds if what they find is not what they had believed

1EA79AC52FDD44A8B01921876179B4C6.description: •	Make careful observations of reversible and irreversible changes, record and explain these using suitable scientific language

7B4B745CB1F34D44BE4BEB91F135E407.description: •	Identify the processes involved when materials change from one state to another (freezing, melting, evaporating, condensing)

30D63745DFFB4055B65006F830F11180.description: •	infer that some materials can change from one state to another (solid, liquid and gas)

08BE8AC89CCE4C82A6655205B626614C.description: •	Classify some changes as reversible and others as irreversible;

87ECF69BFDEF43F187585D3E61AEBBC3.description: •	Distinguish between reversible and irreversible changes

D8659AC83D534CE1B655849E6C61431E.description: •	Conduct an investigation to illustrate that some changes result in the formation of new materials and others do not.

BB932E769DA1441A8BD6DF3693D014B1.description: What changes are reversible and irreversible?

C8AD199882CF4F5D999FABCB3D44CA64.description: •	Be willing to change their minds if what they find is not what they had believed

6B36B425794C4140AD5A44509D073EDC.description: •	Generate predictions of material properties based on observations and experience.

16DB09D3053046F88D162F830E9BB434.description: •	Assess the impact of different materials on the society

03F3B057BC9E40CD8B1D6E7DC783C2D0.description: •	Evaluate how the disposal of selected materials affect the environment

A2E14DB0E7A74B74A08BF459142B3D9A.description: •	Evaluate how the disposal of selected materials affect the environment

E3BED82108754B2EA86289AD4339DDDE.description: •	List some properties of materials that determine the choice of objects for specific purpose in everyday life.

D2E0C161CC554CFDB4B96555D0484C64.description: •	Examine a selection of materials/objects to determine the transparency, absorbency, strength, magnetic property, and heat conductivity of materials in everyday use.

369B463E2BDA4A228EBF115FD86B8F21.description: •	Identify correct and safe ways of using, storing and disposing of materials and household items.

F3E61FAB76A24A4D979E1FC9A78089A2.description: What are some properties of common materials and their everyday uses?

31D60C9BFC634D7AA6E5F2CD133F6E52.description: •	Show curiosity in investigating the property of sounds

09D80EF50EFC44DBB84701599E222356.description: •	Describe sounds using appropriate scientific language

2A14B3F523904B90A914E70CD1FBB2F5.description: •	Formulate hypotheses when conducting investigations into the properties of sound

F5C17C5A11984B029A7CA10DE310F660.description: •	Explain why loud sounds can be harmful

1EB1F4AC4D2740ECA499FF01A2D4175F.description: •	Identify sources of noise pollution, and ways to eliminate them

C34AC8493C344713A855538E2B440817.description: •	Explain why sounds may be interpreted as pleasant/unpleasant

0652EA12286F43AD9EBE83AA0216E6BB.description: •	Value individual effort and team work

30985A19CC10430099D94FA5189DD5F8.description: •	Show objectivity by using data and information to validate observations and explanations about light

B638A275E6A9473A8742180A3638B12F.description: •	Carry out fair tests in conducting investigations on the properties of light

BD8DFB27186546A99EE89DCE6BEB788A.description: •	Investigate some effects of reflection/refraction in everyday life

F42A9A76D3B546578212BB8F7CE9DD7E.description: •	Investigate the interaction of light with lenses/mirrors

4B1131AF53554B5DA94544D680DA5877.description: •	Investigate the interaction of light with materials that are shiny, dull, transparent, translucent and opaque

83E12693716848F797711C9AC5324F6C.description: •	Distinguish between luminous and non-luminous objects/organisms

C6A9D51A277C4BDA81D1B7A9FCE99606.description: •	Be aware of their responsibility to carry out good environmental practices

F9038655A2214933909E70AA8A3BC2AB.description: •	Show concern for the impact of environmental problems on humans

EEF2244AE462423782826C02E0244FA7.description: •	Explain how soil degradation can be prevented

463CBA3107314C33ABFF95BC88C6EDF4.description: •	Describe the factors that cause soil degradation

2B410DF0B8724F729330FAB03144098F.description: •	Explore ways of reducing factors that cause climate change

C61E62218CD44A7598B3AF5D55B0BC20.description: •	Use evidence from everyday local/regional/international situations to explain the effects of climate change on humans

D2BFFA1B2B73448DAC2C90DC5D98F6C6.description: •	Formulate a simple working definition of climate change

96C619982E6F496A9A8E1FE4F11CCE32.description: How do environmental problems affect us?

2D5822576A974DA98160D83DE68D0DC5.description: •	Observe, collect and record information regarding the interacting factors within an environment

72EF7C348C574ED0A551A9076ECE168C.description: •	Be aware of their responsibility to preserve the environment

F87D04D436934B258B299EE2AD7F749A.description: •	Show concern for the impact of humans on the environment

AA925118ACC747E4AB5CC3366220E937.description: •	Recognise the need for and importance of conserving living things and the environment to sustain the balance in the ecosystem.

16BBE1BCEE784D0B922C03BF4185F17E.description: •	Investigate features/ soils of different environments

9350F14406A64D7986FC6621403F8533.description: •	Outline the effects of human activities on the environment

7F2447C99ED0499D9843CC3A87E52AFB.description: Why is it important to care for the environment?
